classes.name: Elementalist
classes.pitch: The elementalist uses Spirit Energy to manipulate various forms of matter - traditionally water, fire, earth, and air.
classes.examples: Avatar: The Last Airbender, Fullmetal Alchemist, Gaara (Naruto)
classes.notes: OUTDATED: table-based class data; update to universal class benefits + features.

classes.name: Henshin Hero
classes.pitch: The Henshin Hero, similar to the Magical Guardian, has two forms. They spend most of their time in their average human forms, but transform for battle. The Henshin Hero is more combat oriented than the Magical Guardian, usually having some innate armor and weapons when they transform.

classes.name: Magical Guardian
classes.pitch: The Magical Guardian uses spirit energy to defend, heal, and enhance their allies. They are primarily a support class, and their magic can provide a wide range of utility.
classes.examples: Sailor Moon, Cardcaptor Sakura, Puella Magi Madoka Magica

classes.name: Mech Pilot
classes.pitch: The Mech Pilot class revolves around channeling their spiritual energy through technology - particularly a piloted robotic vehicle known as a mech.
classes.notes: OUTDATED: table-based class data; update to universal class benefits + features.

classes.name: Metamorph
classes.pitch: The Metamorph uses spiritual energy to modify their own bodies - either whole or in part - into new forms. These new forms include elemental transformations, bestial or alien forms, growing giant, changing their body’s composition to have new material properties, etc.
classes.examples: Titan Shifters (Attack on Titan), Luffy (One Piece - Rubber material), Ben 10, Kirby

classes.name: Monster Tamer
classes.pitch: A monster tamer shares a special bond with one or more creatures that helps them both to grow stronger.
classes.examples: Ash (Pokemon), Tai (Digimon), Yugi Muto (Yu-Gi-Oh), Final Fantasy, etc.

classes.name: Ninja
classes.pitch: A character who uses spirit energy to enhance their stealth, deception, and infiltration. Ninjas are fast, tricky, mysterious, and deadly.

classes.name: Psychic
classes.pitch: The psychic primarily uses spirit energy to enhance their minds, not their bodies. They can use their minds to manipulate objects, read and project thoughts, and eventually even stop time.
classes.examples: Mob Psycho 100, Akira, Jojo’s Bizarre Adventure (Arguably)
classes.notes: OUTDATED: table-based class data; update to universal class benefits + features.

classes.name: Spirit Warrior
classes.pitch: A Spirit Warrior channels Spirit Energy to enhance their physical abilities, and can also release their Spirit Energy in various forms of attack. Focuses on close-combat against a single target. High single-target damage and good bulk. Struggles more with multiple targets and ranged abilities.
classes.examples: Goku (Dragonball), Ryu (Street Fighter), Rock Lee (Naruto), Kenshiro (Fist of the North Star)

classes.name: Weapon Master
classes.pitch: The weapon master is a master of weapons and armor. They use spirit energy to enhance their abilities both offensively and defensively. They channel energy through their weapons to perform incredible feats, such as slicing a boulder in half, deflecting bullets in midair, or swinging weapons with ease that a normal person couldn’t even lift. The weapon master focuses on battlefield control and multi-target damage. Their single-target damage isn’t bad, but doesn’t match up to classes that focus on single combat.
classes.examples: Goemon (Lupin III), Guts (Berserk), Rurouni Kenshin, Ichigo (Bleach)

henshin-hero.name: Hero Transformation
henshin-hero.description: You have an object - such as a Crystal, Technological Device, a watch, or a weapon, that serves as your Transformation object. This object channels your energy, and allows you to transform into a powerful new form. As an action while holding this item you can transform into your Henshin Hero form. This transformation usually involves a costume change, the user being enveloped in energy, and possibly explosions. When you transform into your Hero form, increment your Power Die by 1, and you gain 1 Armor. You also gain the following ability:

henshin-hero.name: Inspiring Aura
henshin-hero.description: Your heroic presence and cinematic fighting style inspires your allies. While transformed, you have an aura that affects allies within 3 squares of you (including yourself). Allies in this aura gain a +1D Status Bonus to Mental Defense rolls. You leave this transformation when you drop to 0 HP, or you spend an action to transform back into your civilian form. Once you have transformed in this way, you cannot do so again until you take a short rest.

henshin-hero.name: Heroic Combat Training
henshin-hero.description: Choose one of the following combat skills: Targeting, Melee Weapons, or Martial Arts. You have a Medium skill progression in the chosen skill. If you choose Targeting or Melee Weapons, you gain 1 Rank 1 weapon that uses that skill.

henshin-hero.name: Emblem
henshin-hero.description: Choose one of the following Emblems. This emblem represents the “theme” of your transformation. Each emblem provides a benefit to the user, as well as an aura that provides a benefit to allies near you.

options.name: Wild Animal
options.description: This emblem takes the form of a wild animal such as a lion, shark, or eagle. You gain the following action: Mark Prey (1 Action) - You choose 1 creature you can see within 10 squares as your prey. That creature becomes “Marked”. Your attacks against the marked creature deal +3 damage. If you attempt to use this ability and already have a creature marked, the previous mark ends. Your enhanced animalist senses allow you to detect signs of danger - allies within your inspiring aura also gain a +1D Status Bonus to Observation.

options.name: Prehistoric Beast
options.description: This emblem takes the form of an extinct prehistoric animal, such as a Dinosaur, Pteranodon, or Mammoth. Titanic Strength - You channel the massive strength and size of a prehistoric beast. Your scale is treated as +1 for the purposes of forced movement. Whenever you would forcibly push or pull another creature, increase the maximum distance by 1 square. When another creature would try to move you, you may choose to reduce that distance by 1 square. Allies in your inspiring aura gain a +1D Status Bonus to Athletics, as they channel the awe-inspiring strength of these ancient creatures.

options.name: Mythical Creature
options.description: This emblem takes the form of a legendary being such as a dragon, phoenix, or unicorn. You gain the following reaction:

options.name: Insect
options.description:
This emblem takes the form of an inconspicuous and adaptable insect, such as a Stag Beetle, Grasshopper, or Butterfly. You gain the following ability:

Extra: Beetle Armor - You gain Armor 5 to Bleeding and Poison
Allies in your inspiring aura gain a +1D status bonus to stealth, as your aura helps camouflage them into their surroundings.

options.name: Element
options.description: This emblem takes the form of a primal element, such as Water, Fire, Earth, or Wind. Choose one of these elements. You gain Rank 1 (Beginner) training in the Elementalism skill using the chosen element, and a “Slow” skill progression with this skill. See the “Elemental Powers” section for details. Allies in your inspiring aura gain Armor 5 against attacks with the chosen element trait.

options.name: Vehicle
options.description: This emblem takes the form of a mechanical vehicle, such as a race-car, fire-truck, or fighter jet. You gain a Rank 1 Vehicle (see the “Vehicles” section for details). While transformed into your Hero form, you can summon your vehicle to you using an action. If you do so, it appears in the nearest unoccupied location to you that is large enough to fit the vehicle. Channeling the speed of a motorized vehicle, allies that start their turns in your aura gain +2 movement speed that turn.

options.name: Ancient Warriors
options.description: This emblem takes the form of a legendary warrior from history, such as a Samurai, Knight, or Gladiator. You gain the following action: Know your Enemy - Channeling the spirit of highly trained warriors, you can adapt to any fighting style. Whenever you critically fail an attack against an enemy, you may make an “Analyze Enemy” investigation action against that creature (no action required). Bolstered by the discipline of these ancient warriors, allies in your Inspiring Aura gain immunity to the charmed,  frightened, and taunted conditions.

magical-guardian.name: Guardian Transformation
magical-guardian.description: As an action while holding your Guardian Accessory, you can speak your transformation phrase to transform into your Magical Guardian form. This transformation usually involves a costume change, the user being enveloped in bright light, and cool particle effects. When you activate your Guardian Transformation, increment your Power Die by 1. You also gain a number of “Charms” equal to your Primary Attribute. When an ally you can see makes a defense roll, you may choose to spend one “Charm” to add +1D to that ally’s roll (after seeing the result of their roll, but before determining the outcome). You can also spend an action to touch a willing creature and expend any number of “Charms” to heal that creature by 5 times the number of charms spent. Once you’ve transformed into your guardian form, you can’t do so again until you take a short rest.

magical-guardian.name: Guardian Accessory
magical-guardian.description: You have an important object - maybe an old family heirloom, personal treasure, or mysterious artifact given by a stranger. This object channels your energy, and allows you to transform.When you transform, your Accessory changes into one of the following forms.

options.name: Dazzling Wand
options.description: Your transformation item takes the form of a beautiful, ornate wand. You learn 1 additional Guardian Spell.

options.name: Shining Weapon
options.description: Choose a Rank 1 weapon - your Transformation Item takes the form of a glowing, ethereal weapon of that type. If you choose a Melee Weapon, you gain Beginner training in the Melee Weapons skill for that weapon. If you choose a Ranged Weapon, you gain Beginner training in Targeting for that weapon. Whichever option you chose, you gain a “Slow” progression in that skill.

options.name: Magnificent Gadget
options.description: Choose a skill you have at least Beginner training in. Your Transformation Object takes a form related to that skill. For example, if you choose the “Medicine” skill, it may transform into a Stethoscope. While holding the object, you have a +1D Item bonus to all rolls using that skill.

magical-guardian.name: Magical Familiar
magical-guardian.description: You have a magical familiar. This familiar may be a magical spirit who grants you powers, a pet who is transformed by your magical abilities, or any number of other whimsical beasts. Create a Rank 0 Familiar using the Familiar Subsystem.

metamorph.name: Metamorphic Transformations
metamorph.description: You know one of the following forms. You can choose to transform into your chosen form as an action. Each form has a number of unique adaptations, and you can choose which adaptations to activate when you transform. You may only have one of these forms active at a time. While transformed, you may spend an action to modify your chosen adaptations, or to switch into a different form (if you have multiple forms known).

metamorph.name: Beast Form
metamorph.description: You take on the properties of animals and beasts. When you transform into this form, choose 2 of the following adaptations: Gliding: You do not take damage from falling. For every square you fall, you may also move horizontally 1 square. Tough Hide: You gain 1 armor. Spikes: Your body is covered in dangerous spikes. Whenever an enemy deals Melee damage to you, they also take damage equal to 1 + your Metamorphosis Rank. Savage Claws: Your melee attacks deal additional damage equal to 1 + your Metamorphosis Rank. Enhanced Senses: You gain a +1D bonus to Perception, and you know the location of creatures within 10 squares of you (even if you cannot see them). Creatures you cannot see are Obscured but not Concealed. Amphibious: You can breathe both air and water, and gain a swim speed equal to your movement speed. Climber: You gain a climbing speed and can move freely on vertical surfaces. Burrower: You gain a burrowing speed equal to half your movement speed. Quadrupedal: You gain +2 Movement Speed Natural Camouflage: You gain a +1D Bonus to Stealth. You are Obscured to Ranged attacks.

metamorph.name: Material Form
metamorph.description: Your body takes on the properties of various materials. When you transform, choose 2 of the following adaptations: Elastic: Your melee attacks gain +1 reach. High Density: Whenever you would be pushed or pulled, reduce the distance by 2 squares. Magnetic: You can push and pull nearby metal objects. Metal weapons have a -1D penalty to attacks against you. If you hit a creature made of metal (or wearing metal armor) with an attack, you can push that creature a number of squares away from you equal to your Metamorphosis rank. Liquid: You can squeeze through small openings and cracks, and can share spaces with other creatures. Slippery: You cannot be immobilized. Sticky: When you succeed on a melee attack against a single target, you may choose to have that creature become grappled. Variable Hardness: When you take damage, gain 1 armor until the beginning of your next turn. If you take damage while you already have an armor bonus due to this ability, increase that bonus by 1.

metamorph.name: Elemental Form
metamorph.description: Your body takes on the properties of various elemental powers. Choose one of the following elements: Water, Fire, Earth, Air, Metal, Ice, Electricity. You gain the following traits for that element: Elemental Resistance: You gain Armor 5 against attacks with the chosen trait. Elemental Strikes: Your attacks gain the chosen trait, and have the “Attack Modifiers” of that element (see the Elemental Powers Subsystem).

metamorph.name: Monstrous Mimicry
metamorph.description: If you are in a square adjacent do a defeated enemy whose Threat Level is less than or equal to your Level, you may spend 1 action to absorb that enemy’s spirit energy. If you do so, you can temporarily transform into a copy of that enemy. This transformation lasts until the end of the combat, or until you spend an action to transform again. TBD - Need Willpower / Strain Hooks

metamorph.name: Higher Level Features
metamorph.description: Elemental movement: gain a movement ability based on the element (flight for air, swimming for water, some may be more difficult to come up with). Elemental Bubble: surround an enemy with a bubble of the element Elemental Beam: A line of elemental power Elemental Aura: The user is surrounded by an aura of elemental energy Careful Elements: You can choose certain creatures to be unaffected by your elemental abilities. Elemental Burst: An AOE elemental ability centered on the user Elemental Wall: Create a barrier made of the element Elemental Immunity: Immunity to damage from the element Elemental Healing: Can absorb element to restore HP Energizing Elements: Can absorb element to gain Energy Elemental Transmutation: Convert one element to another (e.g. wood to earth, metal to water, etc) Elemental Destruction: Destroy / vanish a certain amount of the element from existence Conjure Element: Produce a certain amount of the element from nothing Elemental Storm: A large, damaging “storm” of the element Elemental Transformation: Transform yourself into a new form, where you are entirely made of the element Elemental Teleportation: Teleport through the element, from one instance to another Elemental Summoning: Create a creature made of the corresponding element Elemental Domination: Control and manipulate creatures with the corresponding elemental tag Advanced Element: Gain access to an advanced form of an element you can control Combined Element: Gain access to a new element, formed from a combination of two elements you can control Notes: Should Elementalists be able to perform Elemental Telekinesis without spending Energy (while other classes *do* require energy)?

metamorph.name: Basic Rules
metamorph.description: A mech is a giant robot, usually humanoid, that is piloted by one or more characters.

metamorph.name: Mental Link
metamorph.description: The mech is controlled by a neural link - while the pilot is in the cockpit, their brainwaves are monitored and integrated directly into the mech’s controls. This allows for incredibly fast and precise maneuvering, and also prevents anyone other than the pilot from controlling the mech. However, the link goes both ways - any damage suffered by the mech is also suffered by the pilot. This is represented by the mech and pilot having a shared pool of HP.

metamorph.name: Mech Storage
metamorph.description: The pilot can store the mech when not in use, and summon it as needed. Example forms of storage include shrinking the mech down to the size of an action figure, storing it in an extradimensional plane, or teleporting it to a storage hangar. Regardless of the method chosen, it always requires a single action to summon or banish the mech. It also takes an action to enter or exit the mech, but this can be done as part of the same action in which the mech is summoned or banished.

metamorph.name: Mech Actions and Abilities
metamorph.description: Your mech has a roughly humanoid shape, and is assumed to be able to perform any action a normal human can perform - no check required. However, actions that require fine motor control or interacting with small objects may require a check. They can also perform any special actions that the pilot has access to, as long as that action does not require touch or line of effect. While inside the mech the pilot is enclosed, and line of effect is broken. This also means that the pilot cannot be affected by abilities that require touch or “line of effect” cannot target the pilot (but may target the mech, if applicable). Because the mech is scale 2 or larger, equipment such as weapons and armor that are designed for Scale 1 creatures cannot be used by the mech. While piloting the mech, the pilot is assumed to retain any skills, stats, and abilities that aren’t explicitly modified or overwritten by the mech. Whether it is reasonable for them to be able to use a given ability while piloting is up to the GM.

metamorph.name: Standard Features
metamorph.description: The mech is assumed to have a number of standard features including an airtight climate controlled cabin, speakers and wireless capabilities for communication.

metamorph.name: Mech Frames
metamorph.description: A mech frame determines the basic size, shape, and stats for the mech.

metamorph.name: GD-MS Genesis-01 Frame
metamorph.description: Scale: 2 Speed: 7 squares movement Upgrade Slots: 2 Strength: +2 Agility: -1 Hit Points: +20 Armor: +1 Damage Weakneses: TBD Damage Resistances: TBD Tags: Technology +1D Equipment Bonus to Physical and Spiritual Defenses

metamorph.name: Giant Weapon
metamorph.description: Your mech gains a Rank 1 weapon. This weapon is large enough to be used by the mech, meaning that it is too large to reasonably be used by a normal scale 1 humanoid. The mech also learns 1 Weapon Technique that the weapon qualifies for.

metamorph.name: Martial Mech
metamorph.description: The Mech can perform Martial Arts Techniques, using the Pilot’s Driving Skill, and learns a single Rank 1 technique.

metamorph.name: Grappling Hook
metamorph.description: Your mech has a built-in grappling hook. As an action, you can launch the hook a number of squares equal to 4 times your Scale and reel in the grappling hook. If your target is a creature, you must make an Agility (Targeting) test against their physical defense. If the target’s scale is less than yours, it is pulled towards you. If its scale is greater than yours, you are pulled towards it. If your scale is equal to the target’s, you choose.

metamorph.name: Targeting Computer (Beginner)
metamorph.description: Your mech has an integrated computer aiming system that helps with ranged attacks. You can use your “Technology” skill for rolls that normally use “Targeting”.

metamorph.name: Reinforced Frame (Beginner)
metamorph.description: Thick metal plating that makes the mech more durable - increasing HP bonus or granting additional armor.

metamorph.name: Firewalls (Beginner)
metamorph.description: Grants a +1D equipment bonus against attempts to hack the mech or otherwise interfere with its electronic components

metamorph.name: Jump Thrusters
metamorph.description: The mech gains a set of boosters that grant it a limited form of flight - more akin to enhanced jumps. During your movement you can spend X Energy to fly up to X squares. This distance still counts against your normal movement. If you are not on a stable surface when this flight ends, you fall.

metamorph.name: Hexapede Chassis
metamorph.description: The mech has 6 legs instead of 2, granting it additional mobility and stability. It gains +1 movement, ignores difficult terrain, and cannot be knocked prone. However, it cannot jump.

metamorph.name: Amphibious Hull
metamorph.description: Your mech is adapted to be able to operate underwater. It is watertight, provides a steady supply of breathable air, and is reinforced to withstand underwater pressures. The mech can operate underwater with no penalties, and has a swim speed equal to its movement speed.

metamorph.name: Integrated Weapon
metamorph.description: A one-handed, mech-scale weapon is built directly into the mech’s chassis. This weapon does not require the mech’s hand(s) to operate, and does not require any actions to draw or stow.

metamorph.name: Additional Arms
metamorph.description: Your mech has 4 arms instead of 2. The additional arms have all the functionality of normal arms - they can carry objects, perform attacks, manipulate the environment, etc.

metamorph.name: Rocket Punch
metamorph.description: When making unarmed strikes with your mech, you can propel the mech’s fist forward to increase the power and distance of the attack. You can spend 2X energy to increase the distance by 2X and the damage by X.

metamorph.name: Pile Bunker
metamorph.description: Your mech has the ability to launch a powerful, armor piercing spike, which is integrated with one of their arms. Tags: Reach 1, one-handed, sharp, Integrated Basic Attack: (1 Action + X Energy). Strength(Melee Weapons) or Strength(Martial Arts) vs Physical Defense. Melee, 1 target. Damage: 7 + Hits. Ignores 2X points of armor.

metamorph.name: Chest Beam (Advanced)
metamorph.description: The mech has a powerful integrated beam, which it can use to consolidate and launch all of its energy in a concentrated beam Tags: Energy, Integrated Basic Attack: (1 Action + X Energy). Agility (Targeting) vs Spiritual Defense. Area - 1 by 5 squares. Damage: 5 + Hits + X.

metamorph.name: Rocket Barrage (Advanced)
metamorph.description: The mech launches a swarm of rockets, peppering an entire area of the battlefield. Tags: Explosive, Volley, Integrated Basic Attack: (2 Actions + X Energy). Agility (Targeting) vs Physical Defense. Area - 3 by 3 squares. Damage: 6 + Hits + X

metamorph.name: Energy Barrier
metamorph.description: The mech has a protective forcefield that protects it from energy-based attacks. When you would take damage from an attack that targets spiritual defense, you may spend X energy to prevent up to X points of that damage (no action required).

metamorph.name: Psionic Shielding
metamorph.description: The mech has a special layer of integrated shielding that interferes with incoming psionic attacks. Add +1 to the pilot’s Mental Defense while inside the mech.

metamorph.name: Flight Systems
metamorph.description: The mech gains a flying speed equal to its ground movement speed.

metamorph.name: Electronic Jammer
metamorph.description: The mech can project an electrical field that interferes with the electronic systems around it. This affects a 3 square aura around the mech. All actions with the “electronic” tag, or performed by a creature with the “electronic” tag, take a -1D Circumstance penalty while within the aura. Requires 1 action and 2 energy to activate, and 2 energy per turn to sustain.

metamorph.name: Sensor Suite (Advanced)
metamorph.description: The mech’s sensors are upgraded to be able to view different spectrums, including infrared and spiritual energy signatures. You know the location of invisible enemies, and enemies behind less than 1 square of full cover.

metamorph.name: Self-Repairing Nanites (Master)
metamorph.description: The mech is constructed of millions of tiny nanomachines, which can operate independently and repair damaged parts. The mech regains 5 HP at the end of each of its turns.

metamorph.name: Spaceflight (Higher Rank than Flight)
metamorph.description: Combination ability - can form a larger robot by combining with other Mechs / Vehicles Remote Control Drones (e.g. “Bits” and “Funnels”). What’s actually the difference? “Bit Suits” - Additional Remote Controlled mecha that can be controlled simultaneously (upgrade to “Bits” or “Funnels”)? A.T. Field Projector - Shield tied to Strain, instead of Energy? Berserk Mode - lose control of mech, deals high damage. Consequence of overstrain while using A.T. Field? Special Generator - Provides energy, or reduces energy costs? E.g. “S2 engine”

metamorph.name: Future-Predicting Computer Interface
metamorph.description: “Spiral Power Converter” - Converts Willpower into Energy for the mech?

metamorph.name: Size Increases
metamorph.description: Rocket Barrage - Launch a bunch of rockets.

metamorph.name: Extendable Arms
metamorph.description: Med Bay - Can board and heal another player (requires min scale 3?) Thrusters - Temporary Movement Speed boost? Extended Shield Projectors - larger area shields that protect nearby allies as well as the mech itself? Overclocked / Boosted State - A high powered mode (e.g. “Trans-am”) that temporarily improves the mech’s performance at the expense of Strain

metamorph.name: Giga-Drill - Giant drill that can bust through any obstacle
metamorph.description: Mech-Ception - The mech gets a larger mech that it can pilot from inside? Meta-Mech - The mech is surrounded by a powerful aura of energy, that coalesces into the form of a bigger mech

monster-tamer.name: Monster Companion
monster-tamer.description: You have a Familiar - a creature formed from a strong bond and the power of your spirit energy. Use the Familiar Subsystem to determine the statistics for your familiar. You can choose any archetype and template, as well as 2 Rank 1 or lower Familiar Traits.

monster-tamer.name: Creature Summoning
monster-tamer.description: As an action, you can choose to summon or dismiss your bonded creature. When your creature is not summoned they may disappear to another dimension, or they may be stored in a physical object (such as an orb, figurine, or a card). Your creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points, and it cannot be summoned again until you take a short rest.

monster-tamer.name: Beginner Monster Taming
monster-tamer.description: You gain Rank 1 (Beginner) training in the “Monster Taming” skill. This skill can be used to perform the following action: Tame Monster (1 Action) - Charisma (Monster Taming) vs Mental Defense. Targets 1 adjacent creature. If the creature does not have the “Monster” tag, they automatically succeed on their defense roll against this ability. On a failed defense roll, the creature’s attitude towards you increases by 1 stage (e.g. from Hostile to Neutral, or Neutral to Friendly). On a critical failure, the creature’s attitude towards you becomes friendly, and it is willing to fight for you. This effect ends if you or your allies take any hostile actions towards the creature. You can also make “Investigate Enemy” actions using Intellect (Monster Taming). If you do so, you can ask the question “Can I tame this enemy”, in addition to the normal questions available to the “Investigate Enemy” action.

monster-tamer.name: Tamer Bond
monster-tamer.description: You have a Rank 1 Bond with your Monster Companion. This bond increases automatically as you level up, and is always equal to your Monster Taming skill Rank. If you have multiple Monster Companions, they are considered to have a bond of this same rank with each other. This bond also applies towards any Monsters that critically failed against your “Tame Monster” action. You gain 1 Bond Technique.

ninja.name: Ninja Combat Training
ninja.description: Choose one of the following combat skills: Targeting, Melee Weapons, or Martial Arts. You have a Medium skill progression in the chosen skill. If you chose Targeting or Melee Weapons, you gain 1 Rank 1 weapon that uses that skill.

ninja.name: Exceptional Stealth
ninja.description: Your Stealth Skill is exceptional - you get Advanced training at level 1, and you are allowed to train the Stealth skill up to 1 rank higher than the standard skill rank cap.

ninja.name: Stealth Attack
ninja.description: If you make an attack against a single target while Concealed to that target, increase the degree of success by 1.

spirit-warrior.name: Reactive Strikes
spirit-warrior.description: When an enemy leaves your melee range, you can use a reaction to make a Martial Arts attack against that enemy. On a success, the target’s movement ends (in addition to the attack’s other effects).

spirit-warrior.name: Martial Arts Specialist
spirit-warrior.description: Choose one “Martial Arts Tag” from those listed in the Martial Arts section of the document. You gain a +1D specialization bonus when performing a technique with the chosen tag.

spirit-warrior.name: Combo System
spirit-warrior.description: Your mastery of Martial Arts allows you to string multiple techniques together to perform devastating combos. To perform a combo, you must declare all of the techniques you wish to perform, the targets of those techniques, and spend 3 actions and any required energy up-front. If you do so, the entire combo is treated as a single Activity, and therefore does not suffer from any repeated action penalties. A combo must start with an “Opener”, can contain any number of “Follow-Up”s, and may end with a “Finisher”. It is not required for a combo to contain all three types of moves - the only restrictions are that it must begin with an Opener, and if a finisher is used it must be at the end of the combo. At level 1, if you choose to perform a combo you must spend all 3 actions to do so.

spirit-warrior.name: Warrior’s Mark
spirit-warrior.description: When you hit an enemy with a melee attack, you can choose to mark that enemy as your chosen target. Only 1 enemy may be marked this way at a time, and you cannot switch targets until the current target is knocked out or surrenders. While an enemy is marked in this way, both you and the enemy have a -1D status penalty to attack anyone besides the other. Also, you may make a reactive strike against the marked enemy if they attack a target other than you.

spirit-warrior.name: Stances
spirit-warrior.description: Your character knows 2 of the following Stances.. Each stance grants a passive benefit, as well as a drawback. Entering a stance, or switching between stances, requires an action.

options.name: Emulate the steadfastness of the tortoise - slow but sturdy
options.description: Passive: Gain +1D Status Bonus to all defenses. If you would be pushed or pulled by an enemy ability, reduce the number of squares of movement by your Martial Arts rank. Drawback: Your Speed is halved, and you take a -1D status penalty to attacks.

options.name: Tiger Stance
options.description: Strike with the single-minded ferocity of a hunting tiger. Passive: Add +2 damage to all unarmed strikes Drawback: When you enter this stance you gain the “off guard 1” condition, and this condition cannot be cleared as long as you are in this stance.

options.name: Shark Stance
options.description: Channel the surging speed of a shark, endlessly chasing its prey. Passive: Increase your movement speed by 2. You gain a +1D circumstance bonus to dodge rolls. Drawback: You cannot use “grapple” techniques, and must use at least half of your movement each turn, if possible.

options.name: Crane Stance
options.description: Soar and gently float, like a majestic but fragile crane. Passive: You may expend your movement to perform incredible leaps. You may leap to a maximum height equal to half your movement (rounded down). While in this stance, you do not take fall damage. Drawback: You have a -1D penalty to resist being pushed, pulled, or grappled. When you would be pushed or pulled, you are moved 1 additional square.

options.name: Python Stance
options.description: Restrain and crush your enemies like a powerful constrictor snake. Passive: You gain a +1D status bonus to techniques with the “grapple” tag, you can grapple creatures up to 2 scales larger than you, and moving while grappling does not cost extra movement. Drawback: You cannot use techniques with the “aerial” or “mobile” tags.

options.name: Gorilla Stance
options.description: Like a cornered silverback, you lash out against multiple enemies surrounding you. Passive: When you perform a technique with the “flurry” or “push” tags, you may perform 1 additional unarmed strike or shove on a different target. Your Martial Arts rank is treated as 1 lower for the purpose of this additional attack. Drawback: You cannot mark enemies, and all current marks end.

weapon-master.name: Soulbound Weapon
weapon-master.description: You have a special connection with a particular weapon, and can easily channel your spirit energy through it. You gain a level 1 weapon of your choice. You gain a Specialization in the chosen weapon type (+1D Specialization Bonus). The weapon gains the “soulbound” enhancement (This enhancement does not count towards your weapon’s enhancement slots). Its rank automatically increases, and is always equal to the rank of the skill used to attack with this weapon.

weapon-master.name: Soulbound
weapon-master.description: As an action, you can cause the weapon to teleport from its current location and materialize in your hands, or disappear into a higher-dimensional space. This enhancement CANNOT be removed or exchanged by abilities that allow you to modify your weapon’s enhancements. A soulbound weapon does not take up a weapon slot.

weapon-master.name: Weapon Enhancement
weapon-master.description: Your soulbound weapon is no ordinary weapon. Choose one additional Level 1 weapon enhancement (from the “Weapon” section) to apply to your Soulbound Weapon.

weapon-master.name: Fighting Styles
weapon-master.description: Choose one of the following fighting styles. Each style has a prerequisite, based on your chosen Soulbound weapon. Each fighting style provides a passive buff to weapons of that type, and a recommended technique that fits the style.

weapon-master.name: Sentinel Style
weapon-master.description: Prerequisite: Soulbound Weapon with 'Reach 2+' tag. Sweet-spot : When you hit a creature that is not adjacent to you with a melee attack using a weapon with the 'Reach 2+' tag, you deal an additional amount of damage equal to 2 times your Melee Weapons Skill Rank. Recommended Technique: Keep At Bay

weapon-master.name: Paired Weapons Style
weapon-master.description: Prerequisites: Soulbound weapon with the “One-handed” tag Two-point defense: You gain access to an additional Rank 1 weapon with the one-handed trait. While wielding a one-handed weapon in both hands, Treat the number of enemies adjacent to you as one fewer for the purposes of flanking. Techniques: Dual-Strike

weapon-master.name: Barrage Style
weapon-master.description: Prerequisites: Soulbound Weapon with the 'Thrown' tag. Passive Benefit: While wielding a thrown weapon, all thrown weapons you wield gain the 'Returning' tag for as long as you wield them and have this fighting style. Recommended Technique: Spread Volley

weapon-master.name: Marksman Style
weapon-master.description: Prerequisites: Soulbound Weapon with the 'Ranged' tag. Sharpshooter’s aim: When you take the “Aim” action, also double the range of your ranged weapon attacks. Recommended Technique: Piercing Shot

weapon-master.name: Skirmisher Style
weapon-master.description: Prerequisites: Soulbound Weapon with the 'Ranged' or ‘Thrown’ tag. Point-Blank Proficiency: You do not provoke reactions from creatures when making a ranged or thrown attack while adjacent to them. You also do not take a -1D penalty to these attacks while adjacent to a hostile creature. Recommended Technique: Slowing Shot

weapon-master.name: Titan Style
weapon-master.description: Prerequisites: Soulbound Weapon with the “Heavy” or “Two-Handed” tag. Armor Breaker: When you deal a critical success to a creature with a melee attack using a weapon with the 'Heavy' tag, that creature suffers a -1D penalty to their Physical Defense until the end of their next turn. Recommended Technique: Devastating Blow

weapon-master.name: Guardian Style
weapon-master.description: Prerequisite: Soulbound Weapon with the 'Defensive' tag Vigilant Defense: When you use the “Parry” reaction, you gain a +1D bonus to all other defense rolls until the end of your next turn. Recommended Technique: Protective Parry

weapon-master.name: Smasher Style
weapon-master.description: Prerequisite: Soulbound Weapon with the 'Blunt' tag. Bash: Your blunt weapons gain the “Bash” Alternative Use: Alternative Use - Bash: You swing your weapon to knock away your enemies. On a failure, push the target back 1 square. On a success, push the target 1 additional square for every hit that exceeds their Defense. Recommended Technique: Armor Crusher

weapon-master.name: Blademaster Style
weapon-master.description: Prerequisite: Soulbound weapon with the 'Sharp' tag. Exploit Vulnerability: Bleeding enemies have a -1D penalty to defenses against your attacks Recommended Technique: Vicious Rend

weapon-master.name: Heart Stealer
weapon-master.description: Whenever you drop an enemy creature to 0 hit points, you regain a number of hit points equal to your Strength + Your Level.

feats.name: Additional Emblem
feats.description: Choose an additional Level 1 Emblem from the list. When you transform, you may choose which emblem to use (only one emblem is active at a time). While transformed, you may choose to switch emblems as an action.

feats.name: Additional forms / transformations
feats.description: “Fusion”

feats.name: Chroma Ranger Initiate
feats.description: Chroma Armor: When you transform, your armor takes on a single main hue. Choose a color below. You gain +5 armor against certain attack tags based on the color chosen. Red: Fire Blue: Water Green: Poison Black: Earth Pink: Wind Yellow: Electric White: Ice/Cold Fight as One: You gain a number of “Boosts” equal to your Primary Attribute. When you or an ally in your aura succeeds on an attack roll, you can spend 1 “Boost” to Mark one of the targets. All attacks against the marked target get a +1D Status bonus until the end of your next turn.

feats.name: Giant of Light Initiate
feats.description: Giant of Light Form: While in Hero Form, as an action you may choose to gain 1 strain and transform into a Giant of Light form. When you do, increment your power die. Your scale increases by 1, and you gain +1 armor (stacking with your Hero form’s armor). While in this form you gain +1 strain at the beginning of each of your turns. Once you activate this form, it cannot be activated again until you take a short rest.

feats.name: Switching forms more easily
feats.description: Improved vehicle (flying, underwater, transforming, space)? Extradimensional space (e.g. Triassic Ranger)

feats.name: Calming Beam
feats.description: “Ultra Armor” - immune to heat, electricity, etc

feats.name: Scanning to identify enemy weaknesses
feats.description: Henshin Hero Feats

feats.name: Shrink / freeze enemies
feats.description: “Judge the guilty” (S.P.D.)

feats.name: Stealth Suit
feats.description: “Clock-Up” - speed up, slowing time around

feats.name: temporary / time-limited transformations (color timer)
feats.description: “Ultra Beam”

feats.name: Animal Transformation
feats.description: When you activate your Guardian Transformation, or as an action while transformed, you can enter an animal form. You may choose any Scale 0 or 1 animal that does not have a fly speed or a swim speed. You maintain your mental and spiritual attributes, but your physical attributes match your new form. You retain access to your skills and Powers, but can only perform actions that your new form is capable of.

feats.name: Celestial Knight Path Initiate
feats.description: Celestial Armor: While transformed, your Guardian form gains a suit of magical armor. This armor grants you a +1D Equipment bonus to all defenses while adjacent to an enemy. Knight Combat Training: You do not suffer a penalty when making a ranged Spell attack while within 5 feet of an enemy. You gain Beginner Training and a Slow skill progression in either Targeting or Melee Weapons.

feats.name: Dark Witch Path Initiate
feats.description: Fallen Rose Necklace: While in Guardian Form, as an action you may choose to gain 1 strain and transform into a Witch form. When you do, increment your power die. Additional witch form benefits TBD. While in this form you gain +1 strain at the beginning of each of your turns. If you become overstrained while in this form, roll on the “Curse Table” below. The curse lasts until the end of combat. Once you activate this form, it cannot be activated again until you take a short rest. Design note: I might have to rearrange things a bit, but maybe while in Witch form, every time you successfully hit an enemy with an attack the *enemy* becomes cursed, and rolls on the curse table?

feats.name: Dazzling Transformation
feats.description: Your transformation sequence is so bright and sparkling that it has the potential to dazzle your enemies. When you transform, roll Spellcasting vs Spiritual Defense, affecting all hostile creatures within 4 squares. On a failed defense, those creatures are Off-Guard 1 , or Off-Guard 2 on a critical failure.

feats.name: Merfolk Transformation
feats.description: When you activate your Guardian Transformation, or as an action while transformed, you can activate a Merfolk form. In this form, your legs transform into a fish or dolphin-like tail, you gain the ability to breathe both air and water, and you can swim at a speed equal to your walking speed. Your movement on land is halved in this form, and you cannot jump.

feats.name: Sacred Priestex Staff
feats.description: Your Transformation Object begins to shine with Sacred Spiritual Energy. It has a special store of Energy (separate from your character’s energy) equal to your Spellcasting Attribute, and regains 1 Energy per round. This energy can only be spent on spells to heal an ally, or spells that target a Spirit.

feats.name: Sparkling Idol Path Initiate
feats.description: Sparkling Melody Instrument: This accessory can take the form of any musical instrument, including a microphone. You gain the Idol Inspiration Reaction. Idol Inspiration (1 Reaction): When an ally within 6 squares fails a skill roll, you can inspire them with a quick song. They roll a number of additional dice equal to your Spellcasting Rank. Design note: Work-in-progress

feats.name: Spell Sniper
feats.description: Double the range of all of your attack spells that have a range of at least 2 squares. Enemies do not gain a defense bonus due to being obscured against your spells.

feats.name: Bolstering Aegis
feats.description: Bolstering Aegis (1 Action or Reaction + 3 Energy, Sustained). 1 Target, Range 6 Reaction Trigger: When a creature within range is targeted by an attack. You infuse the target with magical energy, bolstering their defensive abilities. The target gains a +1D status bonus to all defenses for the duration of the effect

feats.name: Counter spell / dispel / spirit energy disruption
feats.description: Group teleport?

feats.name: Guardian Bubble (1 Action or Reaction). 1 Target, Range 6
feats.description: Reaction Trigger: When a creature within range is hit by an attack You surround a creature with a Bubble of protective energy that absorbs damage. This bubble can appear to be made of soap film, glowing energy, hard candy coating, or any number of other materials. The creature gains wards based on your Spellcasting Skill rank and the energy spent. Rank 1:  5 wards, +1 ward per energy Rank 2:  8 wards, +1 ward per energy Rank 3:  11 wards, +1 ward per energy Rank 4:  14 wards, +1 wards per energy Rank 5:  17 wards, +2 wards per energy Rank 6:  20 wards, +2 wards per energy Bond Effect: Grant an additional +1 ward for each bond rank with the target

feats.name: Guardian Feat
feats.description: You learn a single Magical Guardian class feat, or a general feat.

feats.name: Improved healing
feats.description: “Drain Life” - heal a bit when you do damage

feats.name: Instant Transformation
feats.description: When you roll initiative you can automatically transform into your Magical Guardian form (no action required).

feats.name: Memory manipulation
feats.description: Summoning?

feats.name: More “meta-magic” type feats
feats.description: “Split Healing” (when you heal one person, heal another a little also)

feats.name: On a success, the target is stunned 2 (defense roll ends)
feats.description: On a critical success, the target falls unconscious.

feats.name: Prismatic Burst
feats.description: Prismatic Burst: (1 Action + 5 Energy): Primary (Spellcasting) vs Spiritual Defense. Range 8, affects a 2 by 2 square area. All creatures in the area take 5 + Hits damage.

feats.name: Size changing
feats.description: Improved Familiar?

feats.name: Small divination
feats.description: Small conjuration? Reducing Strain?

feats.name: Some kind of armor (spiritual?)
feats.description: Cast spells through armor / weapon attacks and spells at the same time (ranged weapons increase spell range?)

feats.name: Stop time
feats.description: Reverse time / time travel

feats.name: Master Spellcasting
feats.description: Your training in the Spellcasting Skill increases to Rank 3 (Master). Magical Guardian Feats

feats.name: Super Guardian Transformation
feats.description: In dire situations, your Magical Guardian unlocks the ability to ascend to a more powerful form. If your guardian is already transformed, they may spend an additional action and X energy to transform into their “Super” form. In this form gain TBD

feats.name: Access to vehicles
feats.description: “Class Archetype” Initiate feats

feats.name: Amorphous
feats.description: Gelatinous or shape-changing creatures. Slimes, blobs, liquid-based creatures. Fluid Form: Can squeeze through gaps at least 1 inch wide, and can adjust shape to fit any container with the same scale or higher.

feats.name: Amphibious Form
feats.description: Your shape changes to be more suited to navigating the water - your hands and feet become webbed, you sprout gills, and you may gain other traits of aquatic / semi-aquatic creatures. While in this form you can breathe both air and water, and can swim at your normal movement speed.

feats.name: Aquatic
feats.description: Water-based creatures, built for swimming. Fish, amphibians, sea monsters. Water Adaptation: Can breathe underwater and move at full speed while swimming

feats.name: Archetypes
feats.description: An archetype is your familiar’s basic role in the game. Are they a strong, tanky creature that can take a few hits? Or more of an intelligent “partner in crime”, who would rather avoid a battlefield? The archetype determines the familiar’s starting ability scores, grants a unique feature, and determines the statistics for their basic attack. The final attack name is formed by combining modifiers from the corresponding columns in the “Archetype” and “Template” tables

feats.name: Armored
feats.description: Pilots and other occupants gain full cover while inside the vehicle

feats.name: Artifact
feats.description: A powerful magical / technological item grants the heroes their powers. This item is very explicitly NOT created by the character - instead, they were given, chosen by, or simply found the item. The item has a long and mysterious history, which is unknown to the user at first. The artifact can take many forms, but is always at least semi-sentient, and has a will of its own. It has chosen its wielder for a purpose, but they must discover what that purpose is.

feats.name: Attack Modifiers
feats.description: Attacks with the fire tag inflict “Burning 1” on a success, and “Burning 2” on a critical success. Defense rolls against abilities with the Fire tag inflict “Burning 1” on a success, and “Burning 2” on a critical success.

feats.name: Attack Modifiers
feats.description: If a creature fails in a defense against an attack or ability with the “Water” trait, they gain the “Soaked” condition.

feats.name: Attack Modifiers
feats.description: Earth attacks channel the power of rock and stone to deal heavy, crushing blows. These attacks deal additional damage based on the Earth Rank, and knock enemies prone on a critical hit.

feats.name: Attack Modifiers
feats.description: Melee attacks infused with Wind can push enemies a number of squares equal to the Rank of the Wind. Ranged attacks have their ranges increased by an amount equal to the Rank of the Wind.

feats.name: Avian
feats.description: Winged or bird-like creatures, favoring speed. Birds, griffons, harpies, winged reptiles. Gliding Movement: This creature does not take damage from falling (as long as they are not restrained). This creature can expend their movement to move horizontally while falling (up to 1 square of movement per square of falling).

feats.name: Basic Elements
feats.description: Each element is unique, and interacts with the environment in different ways. While they may all share the same list of Elemental Features, the features behave differently depending on which element is being used.

feats.name: Beast
feats.description: Standard animal-like creature, quadrupedal or bipedal. Wolves, tigers, rodents, dogs, felines. Keen Smell: This creature has an enhanced sense of smell with a range of 12 squares. The creature knows the location of hidden or invisible creatures within this range. As long as the creature is not behind an obstruction, it is considered “obscured” to this creature, rather than “hidden”.

feats.name: Bond of Patronage
feats.description: You gain a level 1 Bond with your Patron. Your Patron has certain expectations of you. If you fail to live up to your side of the bargain, the bond can be “Broken”. If this happens, your Patron can choose to restrict access to your powers, or even temporarily prevent you from accessing them entirely.

feats.name: Bond of Patronage
feats.description: You gain a level 1 Bond with your Patron. Your Patron has certain expectations of you. If you fail to live up to your side of the bargain, the bond can be “Broken”. If this happens, your Patron can choose to restrict access to your powers, or even temporarily prevent you from accessing them entirely.

feats.name: Bonded Relic
feats.description: The artifact is not just an object - it has a will of its own, and a unique relationship with its wielder. You gain a Rank 2 bond with the Artifact. This relationship is a two-way street - the Artifact grants you power, but also expects something of you in return. Determine what the Artifact’s goal is, and summarize it in a short statement - a sentence or two. Whenever you perform an action that helps the Artifact further its goal, increment your Power Die.

feats.name: Bug
feats.description: Arthropod-based creatures with adaptable bodies. Beetles, ants, mantises, spiders. Exoskeleton: Gain 1 armor, but reduce movement speed by 1

feats.name: Camouflage
feats.description: Your skin adapts to blend in with your environment. You gain a +1 Status Bonus to Stealth checks.

feats.name: Car
feats.description: Size: 3 x 2 squares (Scale 2) Strength: 5 Agility: 5 Speed: 10 HP: 20 Armor: 1 Tags: Enclosed Upgrade Slots: 3 Occupants: 3

feats.name: Controlling a Vehicle
feats.description: The vehicle does not have its own actions - any actions taken by the vehicle require the Pilot or an Occupant to spend an action. Most vehicles also do not have their own energy, and any energy requirements must be paid by the Pilot or an Occupant. While controlling the vehicle you can perform any actions that the vehicle has, as long as your Driving Rank is high enough to operate the vehicle. While inside a vehicle your character loses the ability to perform most skills and abilities. For example, you cannot perform a Martial Arts Combo against an enemy while driving a car. Players may propose actions that they wish to perform while operating a vehicle, but it is ultimately up to the GM to determine which actions can be taken.

feats.name: Curse
feats.description: Your powers are granted by a curse, hex, or other malicious magic. Although your powers seem like a gift, they come with a cost. 1. Who cursed you? Why? What do they want? 2. Curse should be tied to a character’s past - something they did caused them to be cursed. What is it? 3. How can the curse be broken? Does your character want to break it? 4. What is the cost of the curse? Is the cost something that has already happened, or something that will happen? 5. Is there a drawback to using the powers that the curse grants you? Curse is tied to a vice - using the powers could corrupt the character making them more likely to fall to the temptation of their vice? Examples: Inuyasha, Nezuko (Demon Slayer), Guts (Berserk)

feats.name: Defense Modifiers
feats.description: Squares and objects that are burning can “obscure” a creature on the other side. If a creature is protected by a shield, armor, wall, or aura of flame, all affected squares are treated as if they are burning (but the creature that created the effect is unaffected). This means that if a creature enters a Fire aura, or attacks a creature with a Fire shield, they must make a Physical Defense roll against the fire (as if they had started their turn in a burning square).

feats.name: Defense Modifiers
feats.description: Melee attacks made while either the attacker or target are in water take a -1D Circumstance penalty (unless the attacking creature has a Swim Speed). Ranged attacks that pass through squares containing water have their ranges halved. Creatures that are behind at least 1 square of water are  “Obscured”.

feats.name: Defense Modifiers
feats.description: Defensively, Earth can block line of sight (granting cover), as well as adding additional armor (damage reduction). The amount of armor depends on the Earth Rank. Defensive Earth abilities also grant resistance to Forced Movement. Cover, armor, shields, etc. made from Earth have HP, and can be destroyed by dealing enough damage to them.

feats.name: Defense Modifiers
feats.description: Attacks that pass through an area of wind take a penalty equal to ½ the Rank of the Wind (rounded down, min 1). If these attacks critically fail, the controller of the wind can redirect the attack to target a different creature within range. That creature defends as if they were the original target of the attack. Defensive abilities (such as shields and armor) can also be used to protect the user against falling and forced movement by counteracting it with the force of the Wind.

feats.name: Defensive Evolution
feats.description: Your mutation also helps protect you from external threats. When you take damage, you may spend 2 energy to adapt to that attack. If you do, choose 1 of that attack’s “tags” - you gain Armor (e.g. reduce damage) from attacks with the chosen tag equal to your Strength. For example, if you have Strength 3 and are hit with a fire-based attack, you can gain heat-resistant skin that grants Armor 3 to subsequent “fire” attacks. Lasts until the end of this combat. Once per round when you reduce damage due to Armor, you may increment your Power Die.

feats.name: Defensive power - Ward around self or allies
feats.description: Emotion abilities affect multiple nearby targets? Examples: Power Rangers + Zordon, Cardcaptor Sakura (Cerberus), Deku + All Might (My Hero Academia)

feats.name: Defensive power - Ward around self or allies
feats.description: Emotion abilities affect multiple nearby targets? Examples: Power Rangers + Zordon, Cardcaptor Sakura (Cerberus), Deku + All Might (My Hero Academia)

feats.name: Demon of Hard Work
feats.description: Your powers are not biological, mechanical, magical, or spiritual. You simply learned to enhance your own body, and harness the energy that surrounds you, through sheer hard work. 1. Training is important - downtime requirement? 2. What is your motivation - why do you work so hard? 3. Ultimate Move - Limiter Removal - You always hold yourself back in some way - whether that be carrying around extra weight, wearing physical restraints, or a device that limits your energy consumption. Using your full potential puts a huge strain on your body, but you can do it for short periods of time. Examples: Saitama (One Punch Man), Rock Lee (Naruto), Krillin (Dragon Ball)

feats.name: Earth
feats.description: Earth is the element of stability and protection.

feats.name: Elemental Features
feats.description: When a character is using an Elemental Feature, they choose one (or sometimes more) of the elements that they control to modify the effect.

feats.name: Elements
feats.description: The current list of elements includes Fire, Water, Earth, and Wind. Each of these elements has an associated “tag”, and abilities that manipulate these elements can affect anything with the associated tag. That includes enemies, abilities, and environmental features. Elemental abilities also affect anything in the fiction that is associated with or made out of the element, even if it doesn’t explicitly have the tag. The DM has final say over what can be affected by these abilities.

feats.name: Elite military training - improvements to flanking, teamwork
feats.description: “War Cry” ability?

feats.name: Empowering Tech
feats.description: Once per round, when you make a Skill roll with an equipment bonus, you may increment your Power Die.

feats.name: Enclosed
feats.description: Pilots and other occupants gain partial cover while inside the vehicle

feats.name: Entering / Exiting a Vehicle
feats.description: It takes an action to get in or out of a vehicle.

feats.name: Environmental Effects of Fire
feats.description: A creature that enters a square that is burning, starts its turn there, or makes a melee attack against a target that is burning or in a square that is burning, must make a basic physical defense roll, taking 5 damage on a failure. On a failure, the creature also gains the Burning 1 condition (or Burning 2 on a critical failure). If the creature is already burning, increase the rank of the condition by 1 (e.g. a creature that is currently Burning 2 becomes Burning 3).

feats.name: Environmental Interactions
feats.description: Squares that are filled with water are considered Difficult Terrain for creatures that do not have a Swim Speed. Creatures and objects that enter or start their turn in a square filled with water gain the “Soaked” condition. Creatures that are fully engulfed in water (and cannot breath underwater) must hold their breath. Suffocation rules are TBD.

feats.name: Environmental Interactions
feats.description: Objects and terrain made from Earth are more stable than creations from other elements. A wall made of fire, water, or wind will disappear shortly after an element user stops concentrating on it. A wall made of stone, on the other hand, will remain standing with no additional input. These objects are opaque and solid, and can support the weight of a creature of the same or lesser scale. Earth objects and terrain can be destroyed by taking damage. A 1 square cube of earth at Rank 1 has 10 HP and 2 Armor. Higher ranks will increase the armor and HP.

feats.name: Environmental Interactions
feats.description: Wind terrain creates areas of strong wind that can push creatures around. When creatures enter an area of Wind terrain for the first time, or start their turn there, they are pushed by the wind. When the terrain is created, the direction of the wind is determined (North, South, East, West, Up, or Down). The wind will continue blowing in that direction until the effect is ended or the direction is intentionally changed by the user. The user can choose to change the direction when they sustain the effect.

feats.name: Experiment
feats.description: Your powers are man-made - granted by a scientific or government experiment in which you were an unwilling participant. These powers were triggered by dangerous chemical, biological, or spiritual manipulations, and many of the experimental subjects didn’t survive. You are one of the rare successes, and the organization that performed the experiments will do anything to learn how to repeat the outcome.

feats.name: Exploratory Adaptations
feats.description: Your mutations can be triggered by environmental factors, granting you a number of beneficial adaptations. You can activate these adaptations by spending 1 action and 2 energy. You may only have one adaptation active at a time.

feats.name: Eyes of Legend
feats.description: One of your bloodline’s most foundational techniques is the ability to channel spiritual energy into their eyes. On your turn, you may spend 1 Energy to activate your eye technique, allowing you to see invisible creatures by sensing their spiritual energy. You can also see other traces of concentrated spiritual energy, such as infused objects or the remnants of recent spiritual activity. Activating this ability triggers an obvious physical change in your eyes’ appearance. They may begin to glow, change color, your pupil might change shape, or some other obvious physical transformation.

feats.name: Familiars
feats.description: A Familiar, also called a Monster Companion, is a unique creature that has formed a strong bond with an individual. These creatures may have started out as a normal animal, an object, a virtual pet, or even an imaginary friend. Whatever the familiar’s original form, it was able to form a strong bond with a character. This bond allowed the character to subconsciously share their spirit energy, which transformed the monster into a unique companion. Due to their strong bond with a character, a familiar shares the character’s initiate, action points, and energy pool. All other stats (including attributes, HP, and skills) are separate.

feats.name: Fire
feats.description: Fire is an element of destruction. Its mechanics primarily focus on increasing damage by inflicting the “Burning” condition, and controlling the environment by igniting flammable objects. While it can be a potent destructive force, fire also comes with risks - fire is often uncontrollable, and allies (or even the user themselves) can easily be caught in the flames.

feats.name: Flexible Gadgets
feats.description: You have invented a number of additional utility gadgets equal to your Intellect. You can carry as many of these inventions with you as you wish, but each one takes up a spot in your inventory, and you may only activate one gadget at a time. While activated, each gadget grants a +1D equipment bonus to a single Utility Skill that you have at least Rank 1 training in. You may switch your activated gadget with another in your inventory as an action.

feats.name: Font of Power
feats.description: The entity’s spiritual energy is enormous, and can be drawn upon to enhance your own abilities. However, calling upon such power is not without cost. At any time, you may choose to take 1 Strain and gain a number of energy equal to your Willpower. Once per round, when you take Strain, you may increment your Power Die.

feats.name: Friends in High Places
feats.description: When making a skill check for resources or connections, your Patron may “Assist” you with the roll.

feats.name: Friends in High Places
feats.description: When making a skill check for resources or connections, your Patron may “Assist” you with the roll.

feats.name: Fully transforming into the entity’s true form
feats.description: A “combined form”, that grants full control and access to the entity’s powers Examples: Naruto Uzumaki (9 tailed spirit), Yuji Itadori (Jujutsu Kaisen), Parasyte, Chainsaw Man

feats.name: Gaining wings to fly
feats.description: Gaseous form - turn into an incorporeal cloud? Form made of light? More forms known?

feats.name: Getaba Warrior
feats.description: You are a member of the Getaba Species - a society that is built on a foundation of military prowess. Getaba warriors are some of the most powerful, disciplined warriors in the galaxy. Most of the time they appear mostly humanoid, but with some features that make them somewhat resemble a predatory animal - sharp teeth, slitted pupils, sometimes sharp pointed ears, and a tail. Getaba come in several varieties - some have features resembling Earth Wolves, while others are more akin to big cats such as Leopards or Tigers, or any number of other predatory beasts. When Getaba enter battle these features can become even more prominent, and some Getaba can even transform into a fully bestial form.

feats.name: Hover
feats.description: Vehicles with hover do not use extra movement for difficult terrain, and can move over both water and land.

feats.name: Hover Board
feats.description: Size: 1 x 1 squares (Scale 1) Strength: 2 Agility: 4 Speed: 8 HP: 10 Armor: 0 Tags: Hover Upgrade Slots: 1 Occupants: 0 Hop On: The Hover Board does not require an action to enter or exit the vehicle

feats.name: HP
feats.description: Phys. Def. Ment. Def. Spir. Def.

feats.name: HP
feats.description: Phys. Def. Ment. Def. Spir. Def.

feats.name: HP
feats.description: Phys. Def. Ment. Def. Spir. Def.

feats.name: HP
feats.description: Phys. Def. Ment. Def. Spir. Def.

feats.name: HP
feats.description: Phys. Def. Ment. Def. Spir. Def.

feats.name: Hunter’s Instinct
feats.description: A skilled hunter chooses their prey carefully. You may make an investigation action against a group of enemies, rather than an individual. Examples of questions include: Which enemy has the highest (or lowest) HP? Which enemy has the weakest physical (or mental, or spiritual) defense? Which enemy is the highest Threat Level? Which enemy is the most wounded? Which enemy has the highest Strength (or Agility)? As usual for Investigation Actions, you gain a +1D Circumstance bonus when acting upon this information

feats.name: Ignition and Spread of Flames
feats.description: Flammable objects in a square are ignited if they are targeted by an ability with the Fire tag, within the area of effect of an ability with the Fire tag, or if a creature with the Fire tag starts their turn in that square. At the start of each round, the fire spreads to adjacent squares (including vertically) if those squares are flammable. If an explosive object is ignited, it immediately explodes (the range and damage of this explosion depends on the ignited object).

feats.name: Interaction with Other Elements
feats.description: Water extinguishes fire of equal or lesser scale. Water can conduct lightning. Ice can freeze Water.

feats.name: Interaction with Other Elements
feats.description: Earth can smother flames of an equal or lower rank.

feats.name: Interaction with Other Elements
feats.description: Wind spreads fire. Wind can move or disperse gaseous effects in the environment (e.g. steam, smoke, poison gas).

feats.name: Interactions with Other Elements
feats.description: Water or Earth of equal or greater scale can put out a Fire. Wind can spread Fire. Fire can ignite Wood. Fire can melt Ice (turning it into Water).

feats.name: Inventor
feats.description: The character created machines / technology that manipulates energy for them, granting them special powers. This character does not actually have “Powers” per-se, but can mimic their effects with their technology.

feats.name: Irresistible Authority
feats.description: Your patron’s influence is powerful and widespread. With the mere mention of their name, other creatures become more willing to help (or fear) you. When you perform an action with the “Emotion” trait, you can spend a number of energy up to your Bond Rank with your Patron. Add a status bonus to the roll equal to the amount of energy spent. Your Patron’s authority over you also helps shield you from other, lesser influences. You can also gain this Status Bonus when making a defense check against an effect with the “Emotion” trait.

feats.name: Irresistible Authority
feats.description: Your patron’s influence is powerful and widespread. With the mere mention of their name, other creatures become more willing to help (or fear) you. When you perform an action with the “Emotion” trait, you can spend a number of energy up to your Bond Rank with your Patron. Add a status bonus to the roll equal to the amount of energy spent. Your Patron’s authority over you also helps shield you from other, lesser influences. You can also gain this Status Bonus when making a defense check against an effect with the “Emotion” trait.

feats.name: Keen Senses
feats.description: Your senses of hearing and smell are particularly sensitive. Using these powerful senses, you can detect the presence of hidden non-spirit creatures within 60 feet of you. You know their location, and they are only considered to be “obscured”, rather than “concealed”. In addition, if you know the scent of a particular creature or object, you can detect if they were in a particular location within the last hour, and if they are within 1000 feet you can detect which direction they are in.

feats.name: Legend Reborn
feats.description: You are a reincarnation of a hero from the past. You inherit their powers, and perhaps some of their memories, but are still learning how to access them. You were reincarnated in this time and place for a reason - there is an evil from your past that has risen again, and it is up to you to stop them once again. Example Characters - Aang / Korra (Avatar Universe), Yugi Muto (Pharaoh Atem), Sailor Moon (Queen Serenity), Link (Legend of Zelda)

feats.name: Living Archive
feats.description: The Artifact grants its wielder more than just power - it can share a wealth of knowledge as well . This knowledge may be innate, or it may have been accumulated over time from the collective knowledge of its past wielders. Either way, the Artifact can allow its wielder to occasionally tap into this knowledge. The Artifact starts out knowing 3 Skills. When its wielder makes a skill check using one of those known skills, they can spend 2 energy to allow the Artifact to “Assist” them on the action.

feats.name: Lurking Threat
feats.description: The entity inside you doesn’t enjoy being restrained, and is always looking for an opportunity to break free. When you drop to 0 HP or become Overstrained, the entity seizes the opportunity and temporarily possesses you, gaining control of your body and activating an “unleashed” transformation. During this transformation your appearance changes to more closely resemble the Entity’s true form. When you enter this form you regain all of your HP. While transformed, you must attempt to deal as much total damage to other creatures as possible, and make no distinction between allies and enemies. Any time you would deal damage to a creature, deal additional damage equal to your Willpower. This form ends when you drop to 0 HP again or combat ends.

feats.name: Machine
feats.description: Artificial or mechanical beings with unique construction. Golems, robots, drones. Mechanical Resilience: Immune to effects that require a biological body, such as poison or disease.

feats.name: Magical Dimension
feats.description: You have recently arrived in this world from another. In your homeworld, magical powers are commonplace - a far cry from the mundane, modern world you now find yourself in. Although you are no longer in your homeworld, you retain your supernatural abilities.

feats.name: Making a Familiar
feats.description: Choose the following: An “Archetype”, a creature “Template”, and 2 Level 1 Features.

feats.name: Manifest Spirit
feats.description: You cannot control your power directly - rather, it is controlled by your subconscious, and manifests as a separate entity. 1. Emotional link - because the power is subconscious, it is strongly affected by your emotions. Choose an emotion that strengthens the spirit, and a different emotion that weakens it. 2. Tethered Spirit - the spirit can move and use abilities on its own (still requiring your actions and energy to use). It gets weaker the further it strays from your location. Any damage the spirit takes is passed along to you. 3. What form does this spirit take? How does this reflect or react to your emotions? 4. How did your character first manifest this spirit? (Moment of extremely strong emotion) 5. Ultimate Move - Behind the Mask - The spirit undergoes a transformation, unlocking greater power. This is connected with a moment of clarity or emotional growth of the character Examples: Jotaro Kujo (Star Platinum), Joker (Arsene), Tokoyami (My Hero Academia)

feats.name: More potent inventions (+2D equipment bonus)
feats.description: Shared Inventions (Other characters may activate and equip gadgets) Power Bank - A limited battery of Spirit Energy that can be used to power abilities Microverse Backpack - inventions do not take up inventory space, stored in pocked dimension Portable workshop - Upgrade to Microverse Backpack - can carry an entire workshop in a pocket dimension Quick-Swap - Switching inventions once per turn does not require an action Examples - Tony Stark, Rintarou Okabe (Steins;Gate), Bulma (Dragon Ball), Syndrome (Incredibles)

feats.name: Motorcycle
feats.description: Size: 2 x 1 squares (Scale 2) Strength: 4 Agility: 8 Speed: 12 HP: 15 Armor: 0 Tags: Light Occupants: 1 Upgrade Slots: 2

feats.name: Mutation
feats.description: You are the next step in genetic evolution, and your powers are rooted in your unique biology. In addition to granting you your abilities, your mutation makes you more able to adapt to your environment and circumstances. In mere moments, you can adapt to situations that would normally take evolution millions of years to overcome. However, these abilities come at a cost - your physical adaptations clearly mark you as “other”, and can make it more challenging to fit in with society.

feats.name: Occupants
feats.description: Depending on the type of vehicle, there may be room for 1 or more Occupants (not including the Pilot). All occupants must be at least 1 scale lower than the vehicle. An occupant moves with the vehicle, but has no control over the vehicle’s movement. Depending on the vehicle’s features, an occupant may be able to perform other vehicle actions (for example, firing a mounted weapon).

feats.name: Off-road
feats.description: Off-road vehicles do not use extra movement for difficult terrain

feats.name: Omnidirectional
feats.description: The vehicle can move in any direction, and does not have a “facing” direction

feats.name: Pickup Truck / Jeep
feats.description: Size: 4 x 2 squares, 2 squares high (Scale 2) Strength: 6 Agility: 5 Speed: 9 HP: 25 Armor: 1 Tags: Enclosed, Off-road Upgrade Slots: 4 Occupants: 3

feats.name: Pilot
feats.description: Most vehicles require a Pilot (sometimes also called a Driver) to control it. The Pilot must be at least 1 Scale smaller than the vehicle, and be capable of operating the vehicle.

feats.name: Plant
feats.description: Plant-like or fungal creatures with regenerative abilities. Living plants, mushroom-based lifeforms. Regrowth: The creature regenerates 2 HP at the start of each of it’s turns

feats.name: Powerful Inventions
feats.description: Your character’s “Powers” come from their inventions. This means that they have a physical form, and take up physical space. Your character can only use their powers when they are “equipped”, and they take up space in their inventory. Your powers gain the “Technology” tag, and lose the “Magic” tag (if any).

feats.name: Powerful Patron
feats.description: You get your powers from another, more powerful being - whether an ancient spirit, a powerful energy-user, or extradimensional being. This Patron grants you access to a portion of their power, but they expect something from you in return. Your patron is not just powerful spiritually - they also have influence, resources, and connections that you can occasionally tap into to help you accomplish their goals.

feats.name: Reptilian
feats.description: Cold-blooded creatures, often tough and hardy. Dinosaurs, lizards, turtles, dragons. Tough Scales: Gain 1 Armor against attacks targeting physical defense (reduce damage by 1).

feats.name: Shrinking
feats.description: Body splits into multiple parts, controlled separately? Monster Library - keep a limited library of forms of defeated enemies you can switch into?

feats.name: Slimefolk
feats.description: You get your powers from another, more powerful being - whether an ancient spirit, a powerful energy-user, or extradimensional being. This Patron grants you access to a portion of their power, but they expect something from you in return. Your patron is not just powerful spiritually - they also have influence, resources, and connections that you can occasionally tap into to help you accomplish their goals.

feats.name: Soul Reader
feats.description: You may perform Investigation Actions using Attunement instead of Intellect. Once per round, when you act upon knowledge learned from an Investigation Action, you may increment your Power die.

feats.name: Soul Vessel
feats.description: Your power comes from another spirit or being that lives within you. This relationship is mutualistically symbiotic - you rely on the entity for power, and it relies on you for survival. However, that doesn’t necessarily make it friendly - the entities are often malevolent, and don’t necessarily take kindly to having to share their power.

feats.name: Speedboat
feats.description: Size: 6 x 3 squares (Scale 2) Strength: 5 Agility: 6 Speed: 10 HP: 30 Armor: 1 Tags: Aquatic Upgrade Slots: 3 Occupants: 5

feats.name: Spiritual Bloodline
feats.description: You come from a bloodline with an innate and powerful connection to the flow of spiritual energy. Thanks to your family's special sensory abilities you can sense the flow of spirit energy and see spirit phenomena that are normally invisible to others. You have heard legends of ancestors that were able to perform incredible feats of spiritual power, but you are still just beginning to scratch the surface of the potential that lies within you. However, along with these incredible gifts, you also carry the incredible burden of familial expectations and traditions.

feats.name: Templates
feats.description: A familiar’s “Template” is the basic type of creature that they are. This also grants a unique trait, and can modify their basic attack.

feats.name: Temporary Gliding / Flight
