feats.description: “Natural Armor” - increased physical defenses “Natural Weapons” - spikes, claws, teeth Size changing? Enhanced senses? Examples: Tsuyu Asui (My Hero Academia), Titan-shifters (Attack on Titan), Diclonius (Elfen lied)

feats.name: Thrill of Battle
feats.description: Once per round, when you take damage from a melee attack, you may increment your Power Die.

feats.name: Titan Shifter Path Initiate
feats.description: Titan Form: (1 Action) Increment your power die. Your scale increases by 1. Your Titan Form can stack with your Metamorphic Transformations. This form lasts until the end of the combat, or until you choose to end it (no action required). Once you activate your Titan Form, you cannot do so again until you take a short rest. Turn Limbs into weapons?

feats.name: Upgrading and Repairing Vehicles
feats.description: When vehicles take damage, they can be restored to full HP by taking the “Repair” downtime action. If you have unlocked upgrades for your vehicle, you can also spend a downtime action working on the vehicle to install the upgrade, or swap with an existing upgrade.

feats.name: Vehicle Actions
feats.description: Run Over (1 Action) - Can only be performed if the vehicle moved at least 4 squares towards the target immediately before the action. The target must be in a location that the vehicle could move into based on it’s “facing” direction. Roll Agility (Driving) vs Physical Defense. Melee, 1 target. Damage: 5 + Hits + the Vehicle’s Strength. The vehicle and all occupants take ½ the damage dealt. On a success, if the vehicle is at least 1 size larger than the target, the target is pushed back 1 square (or 2 squares on a critical success).

feats.name: Vehicle Movement
feats.description: A vehicle’s movement is separate from its pilot’s - for example, a pilot may move on their turn, spend an action to enter the vehicle, then drive the vehicle up to its speed in the same turn. Unlike characters and monsters, vehicles have a “facing” direction. Vehicles can only move in the direction that they are facing, or a diagonal direction that includes the facing direction. They can move in reverse, but each square of reverse movement costs 2 squares. Vehicles can expend 1 square of movement to turn 90 degrees.

feats.name: Vehicle Rules
feats.description: Vehicles are a special type of equipment that enhances a user’s mobility, while also potentially providing offensive and defensive benefits. Vehicles require a pilot to operate, and may optionally have room for additional occupants.

feats.name: Vehicle Stats
feats.description: Vehicles have their own stats, including HP, Strength and Agility. Vehicles may also have their own skills - for example, most vehicles have a “Physical Defense” skill. While inside a vehicle, you will use the vehicles stats and skills instead of the stats and skills of your character. If a vehicle does not have a particular stat or skill (such as intellect) continue to use your character’s stat instead.

feats.name: Vehicle Templates
feats.description: A Vehicle template is the starting point for creating a custom vehicle. It determines the initial fundamental stats of the vehicle, including size, speed, and HP. Templates have a “Rank” - a character can only operate a vehicle if their “Driving” skill rank is at least the rank of the vehicle.

feats.name: Vehicles in Combat
feats.description: Attacks against a vehicle may choose to target *either* the vehicle itself or the Pilot (as long as the vehicle does not grant the pilot full cover. When a vehicle drops to 0 hit points, it becomes inoperable. Characters may still enter and exit the vehicle normally, but it cannot move or perform any actions.

feats.name: Wall Crawler
feats.description: You gain the ability to cling to vertical surfaces, allowing you to climb at full speed. You can climb even smooth surfaces and ceilings, as long as they are not wet or slippery.

feats.name: Water
feats.description: Water is the element of healing and disruption.

feats.name: Wind
feats.description: Wind is the element of mobility. Most wind abilities have to do with movement - either by enhancing your own movement, or using wind to redirect other creatures, objects, etc. See the “Forced Movement” section for more information.

feats.name: Absorb Elements
feats.description: Absorb Elements: (1 Reaction) Reaction Trigger: You are damaged by an effect with an elemental tag Reduce the damage by an amount based on your metamorphosis skill rank and the amount of energy spent. Your next attack gains the trait of the element you absorbed with this technique, and deals additional damage equal to the amount of damage reduced. Rank 1:  Damage Reduction: 4, +1 per energy Rank 2:  Damage Reduction: 6, +1 per energy Rank 3:  Damage Reduction: 8, +1 per energy Rank 4:  Damage Reduction: 10, +1 per energy Rank 5:  Damage Reduction: 12, +2 per energy Rank 6:  Damage Reduction: 14, +2 per energy

feats.name: Bestial Claw Slash
feats.description: Tags: Sharp Bestial Claw Slash: (1 Action): Primary (Metamorphosis) vs Physical Defense. 1 Target, Melee Reach 2 You transform your hands into sharp claws, which you use to slash at your opponent. This attack does damage based on your Metamorphosis skill rank and the amount of energy spent. Rank 1:  Damage =  6 + Hits, +1 damage per energy Rank 2:  Damage =  9 + Hits, +1 damage per energy Rank 3:  Damage =  12 + Hits, +2 damage per energy Rank 4:  Damage =  15 + Hits, +2 damage per energy Rank 5:  Damage =  18 + Hits, +3 damage per energy Rank 6:  Damage =  24 + Hits, +3 damage per energy

feats.name: Binding Vines
feats.description: Binding Vines: (1 Action + 3 Energy (Sustained)): 1 Target, Melee Reach 5 Damage: 4 + Hits. On Success: The target is grappled. This grapple does not use up one of your hands. A target grappled this way takes 4 damage at the beginning of each of their turns. On Critical Success: The target is also stunned 1 until the end of their next turn.

feats.name: Doppelganger
feats.description: Doppelganger: (1 Action + 3 Energy) You take on the appearance of a specific individual you have seen. If someone is familiar with that person, make Primary (Metamorphosis) vs Mental Defense roll to fool them.

feats.name: Elemental Chaos Strike
feats.description: Elemental Chaos Strike: (1 Action + 3 Energy): Primary (Metamorphosis) vs Physical Defense, 1 Target, Melee You transform your fist into an elemental form and use it to strike your enemies. Roll a d8 to determine the chosen element. Your attack has that tag, and the attack modifiers of the chosen element. Damage: 8 + Hits

feats.name: Rubber Punch
feats.description: Rubber Punch: (1 Action): Primary (Metamorphosis) vs Physical Defense. 1 Target, Melee Reach 2 You transform a limb into a stretchy, rubbery material, allowing you to punch or kick from a further distance. This attack does damage based on your Metamorphosis skill rank. For each energy you spend on this attack, increase the Reach by 1. Rank 1:  Damage =  4 + Hits, Rank 2:  Damage =  7 + Hits Rank 3:  Damage =  8 + Hits Rank 4:  Damage =  11 + Hits Rank 5:  Damage =  12 + Hits Rank 6:  Damage =  18 + Hit

feats.name: Savage Bite
feats.description: Savage Bite: (1 Action + 3 Energy): Primary (Metamorphosis) vs Physical Defense, 1 Target, Melee You bite your target with powerful, beastlike jaws. Damage: 9 + Hits On Success: The target is Bleeding 2 On Critical Success: The target is Bleeding 4

feats.name: Swiss Army Hands
feats.description: Swiss Army Hands: (1 Action + 3 Energy) Your hands transform into a mundane scale -2 object, such as a magnifying glass or a lockpick. This object can have simple mechanical components. While transformed in this way, if the object would be beneficial to a skill check, you gain a +1D equipment bonus to that check.

feats.name: Monster Evolution or Collection
feats.description: Choose one of the following: Monster Evolution - One of your Monster Companions gains a new evolution. Choose one of your Monster Companions. If the rank of that companion is lower than your Monster Taming skill, increase its Rank by 1. Otherwise, if that creature does not have a Stage 2 evolution, it gains a Stage 2 evolution and one additional Familiar trait. Stage 2 Evolution (1 Action + 3 Energy). Your Monster Companion transforms into a new, more powerful form. It is treated as 1 Rank higher, and gains 1 Familiar trait of its new Rank or lower. If the creature already has a Stage 2 transformation, it gains a Stage 3 transformation and an additional Familiar trait. Stage 3 Evolution (1 Action + 5 Energy). Your Monster Companion transforms into a new, more powerful form. It is treated as 2 Ranks higher than its base rank, and gains 1 Familiar trait of its new Rank or lower. Monster Collection - You gain a new Monster Companion. Its rank is 1 less than your Monster Taming skill. You make this choice again at levels 4, 6, 8, and 10.

feats.name: Advanced Monster Taming
feats.description: Your training in the “Monster Taming” skill increases to Rank 2 (Advanced).

feats.name: Illusion School
feats.description: You can generate minor visual illusions. As an action, you can expend 1 energy to create a simple, immobile visual illusion that does not exceed 5 feet in any dimension. You can only have one such illusion active at a time. In addition, you gain +2 to detect or resist visual, auditory, and mental illusions.

feats.name: Shadow School
feats.description: Improves ability to hide in shadows, maybe teleport from shadow to shadow

feats.name: Summoning School
feats.description: You gain a Rank 1 Familiar (See Familiar Subsystem).

feats.name: Disable spiritual energy (e.g. pressure points)
feats.description: 5 point palm exploding heart

feats.name: Flight
feats.description: Various beams, spirit bombs, etc. “Ultra Instict” - instinctively avoid attacks

feats.name: Incredible feats of strength / destruction
feats.description: Resistance to changes in gravity, etc. Temporarily boosting strength at a cost (Chakra gates, Kaio-ken) Various martial arts techniques - whirlwind kick, rising kick, etc.

feats.name: Instant teleportation
feats.description: Form changes (e.g. super saiyan) - difficult to control / cause rage?

feats.name: Qi Blaster Initiate
feats.description: This path grants additional control over the spiritual energy that courses through your body. Reduce the energy cost of Martial Arts techniques with the “Spirit” tag by 1. When you perform the “Spirit Blast” technique, you can spend additional energy to modify the range and shape of the attack. 3 energy - Instead of a single target, the attack deals damage to creatures in a 3 square cone or a 6 square line. Note: Energy spent in this way does not increase the damage of the attack

feats.name: Soulrager Initiate
feats.description: The power inside of you is more than you can control, so most of the time it stays locked down. However, in moments of intense danger the power can come bursting out. As an action you can choose to gain 1 strain and transform into your Soulrager form. When you activate your Soulrager Transformation, increment your Power Die by 1. You gain armor equal to your Martial Arts rank, and your unarmed strikes also deal increased damage equal to this amount. At the beginning of each of your turns, you gain 1 strain while in this form. Whenever you exit this form, or become overstrained while in this form, you take damage equal to your current strain. Once you activate this form, it cannot be activated again until you take a short rest.

feats.name: Spirit Manipulator Initiate
feats.description: This Path can not only manipulate the Spirit Energy in themselves, but also in others. Once per round, when you roll a success on a Martial Arts attack against a marked enemy, you may reduce that enemy’s Energy by 1, and increment your Power Die. As an action, you may also spend energy to restore hit points to yourself or one adjacent ally. You restore HP equal to 2 * the amount of energy spent.

feats.name: Split Focus
feats.description: You are experienced at fighting multiple opponents at once. You may mark up to 2 enemies simultaneously, and do not take a -1D penalty for attacking enemies that are not marked. When you perform a Martial Arts technique that allows more than one strike, you may perform those strikes against different targets and may move between strikes.

feats.name: Stance Adept
feats.description: Gain an additional Rank 1 Stance. When you roll initiative, you may immediately activate a stance (no action required).

feats.name: What Doesn’t Kill You
feats.description: Once per combat, when your health would drop to 0, instead of becoming defeated you regain HP equal to 2 * Strength, and increment your Power Die.

feats.name: Commander Path Initiate
feats.description: This path focuses on support and leadership.You gain the following benefits: Shared Heart: When your Heart Stealer feature activates, instead of restoring HP to yourself you can choose to restore HP to one ally you can see that you share a bond with. Tactical Order: You gain a number of “Commands” equal to your Heart attribute. When an ally you can see makes a attack roll, you may choose to spend one “Command” to add +1D to that ally’s roll (after seeing the result of their roll, but before determining the outcome). You may also spend 1 action and 1 command to grant 1 additional action to an ally you can see.

feats.name: Energy Reservoir
feats.description: Your Soulbound weapon serves as a reserve of energy, and can store an amount equal to your Attunement. As an action you can retrieve this energy from your weapon, increasing your own pool of available energy. The weapon’s reserves recharge when you take a short rest.

feats.name: Ghostwalker Path Initiate
feats.description: You are able make your body semi-incorporeal, allowing you to (and your weapon) to temporarily phase through obstacles. When you move, you can move through objects and enemies (but cannot end your turn in the same space as another creature or object). You know the locations of creatures behind full cover, and they are only obscured (but not concealed) from you. When you make an attack, you may spend 3 energy to ignore cover for that attack, as your weapon phases through the obstacle.

feats.name: Soul Stealer
feats.description: Once per round when you trigger Heart Stealer, instead of healing yourself you may choose to increment your Power die instead. If you defeat a creature whose threat level is equal to or higher than your level, you may instead choose to regain 1 action point. Possible Feats / Class Features (Uncategorized)

feats.name: Soulbound Pair
feats.description: Prerequisite: One-handed soulbound weapon You gain a second one-handed soulbound weapon. Both weapons are treated as a single weapon - they can both be summoned as part of the same action, and any weapon enhancements on your soulbound weapon apply to both (as long as they meet the prerequisites).

feats.name: Warden Soul Path Initiate
feats.description: Your soulbound weapon is able to manifest as a visible, but incorporeal, spirit. It is treated as a Rank 1 familiar with the “Spirit” template. You also gain the following benefits: Soulguard Defender: Your weapon spirit helps defend you against spiritual attacks. You gain armor 1 vs Spiritual Defense Rolls. Your Weapons with the “Defensive” tag can parry attacks that target Spiritual Defense, as well as Physical Defense.

feats.name: Weaponsmith
feats.description: Choose an additional Level 1 weapon enhancement, and apply it to one of your weapons. This enhancement does not count towards that weapon’s enhancement slots. When you take a short rest, you can change this enhancement (either replacing it with a different enhancement, or moving it to a new weapon).

feats.name: Advanced Weapon Training
feats.description: You can choose to either upgrade your existing Soulbound Weapon to a Rank 2 version of the same base, or choose a new Rank 2 weapon base. You gain one additional enhancement for your Soulbound Weapon (which can be up to Rank 2), and you can also swap one of your existing enhancements with a new one of Rank 2 or lower.

feats.name: Weapon Master Feat
feats.description: Learn a single Weapon Master class feat, or a general feat. (Need level 4+ feats)

feats.name: Master Weapon Training
feats.description: Your training in the Melee Weapons and Targeting skills increases to Rank 3 (Master). You can choose to either upgrade your existing Soulbound Weapon to a Rank 3 version of the same base, or choose a new Rank 3 weapon base. You gain one additional enhancement for your Soulbound Weapon (which can be up to Rank 3), and you can also swap one of your existing enhancements with a new one of Rank 3 or lower.

feats.name: Spirit Beast Transformation
feats.description: Your weapon manifests as a spirit creature - such as a dragon, tiger, phoenix, etc. The movements of your weapon direct the movements of the creature.

feats.name: Weapon Transformation
feats.description: Choose one of the following Stage 1 weapon transformations. You can spend 1 Action + 3 Energy to transform your weapon into the new form. The weapon still functions as a weapon - it retains all of its enhancements, techniques, etc. While in the new form, your Skill rank for the appropriate Weapon Skill (Melee Weapons or Targeting) is treated as 1 Rank higher.

feats.name: Colossus Transformation
feats.description: You summon an enormous spiritual construct around you. It mimics your movements, and wields an enlarged version of your weapon. Sustained technique. Increases attack range and damage, also increases defenses? Feats

feats.name: Ultimate Weapon Transformation (Level 11)
feats.description: Choose one of the following Stage 2 weapon transformations. When your weapon is in a Stage 1 transformation, you can spend 1 Action + 5 Energy to transform your weapon into Stage 2. The weapon still functions as a weapon - it retains all of its enhancements, techniques, etc. While in the new form, your Skill rank for the appropriate Weapon Skill (Melee Weapons or Targeting) is treated as 2 Ranks higher than your normal skill rank (e.g. 1 Rank higher than your Stage 1 transformation).
